entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 10 at 11:59AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 50 below zero.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 10 at 5:01AM PST until February 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG PERIOD NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING RISK OF SNEAKER WAVES TO BEACHES EARLY THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... .A long period northwest swell with period 16 to 18 seconds is impacting the coastal waters. This enhanced wave energy will increase the risk of sneaker waves and rip currents. With warm weather in the forecast, beachgoers need to be aware of these
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 5:51PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds This Evening... A quick moving storm system will bring gusty south to southwest winds to parts of southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa through 9 or 10 pm. Winds in open or wind favored areas may gust 35 to 50 mph. Use caution if traveling, especially high profile vehicles.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas.

entry.summary: ...ICY SPOTS WILL DEVELOP THIS EVENING... Periods of wet snow this afternoon and evening have initially melted on contact on most paved surfaces. entry.summary: ...Period of Snow This Evening With Slick Travel... Snow moves in later this afternoon into the early evening. Bulk accumulations will occur this evening with 2-4" possible from snowfall rates of 1/2 to 1" per hour. In the wake of the storm, patchy freezing drizzle could linger into the early morning hours. If traveling tonight, be prepared for wintry driving conditions.
